# Custom Input

Shiny comes with a variety of inputs ranging from buttons to text fields, these inputs send data from the client to the R server. Custom inputs are in fact no different than from shiny's out-of-the-box inputs, they work very much the same way.

To explain and demonstrate how to build such a custom input we shall build a somewhat more sophisticated of shiny's `textInput` using Bootstrap 3 input group addons which allow placing content before or after the text field.

![Bootstrap 3 input group addons](images/bootstrap-input-group-addon.png)

Custom shiny inputs very much resemble shiny outputs though they consist of a single R function which generates the HTML and attaches necessary dependencies, e.g.: `selectInput`. For instance below one can run the `shiny::textInput` function to see the HTML it generates in the console.

```r
shiny::textInput("theId", "The label")   
```

```html
<div class="form-group shiny-input-container">
  <label class="control-label" for="theId">The label</label>
  <input id="theId" type="text" class="form-control" value=""/>
</div>
```

The R functions is paired with an input binding akin to the output binding use in the previous chapter.

## Generate HTML Input

Let us start with the R function to be used in the shiny UI.

```r
textInputPlus <- function(id, extra = "@", placeholder = "placeholder", 
  position = c("start", "end")) {
  
  position <- match.arg(position)

  aria <- sprintf("%s-aria", id)

  extra <- span(class="input-group-addon", id = aria, extra)
  
  el <- tags$input(
    type = "text",
    class = "form-control",
    placeholder = placeholder,
    `aria-describedby` = aria
  )

  if(position == "start")
    el <- tagList(extra, el)
  else 
    el <- tagList(el, extra)

  div(class = "input-group", el)
}
```
